chapter.heading: ORGANIZATION AND MEMBERSHIP OF THE JOINT COMMITTEE

tocItem.column: Election of chairman and vice chairman.

content.p: There shall be a joint congressional committee known as the Joint Committee on Taxation (hereinafter in this subtitle referred to as the “Joint Committee”).

note.heading: Amendments
note.p: 1976—Pub. L. 94–455 struck out “Internal Revenue” after “Committee on”.

note.heading: Effective Date of 1976 Amendment
note.p: Pub. L. 94–455, title XIX, § 1907(c), Oct. 4, 1976, 90 Stat. 1836, provided that: “The amendments made by this section [amending this section and sections 8004, 8021, and 8023 of this title and enacting provisions set out below] shall take effect on the first day of the first month which begins more than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act [Oct. 4, 1976].”

note.heading: References to Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation
note.p: Pub. L. 94–455, title XIX, § 1907(a)(5), Oct. 4, 1976, 90 Stat. 1836, provided that: “All references in any other statute, or in any rule, regulation, or order, to the Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation shall be considered to be made to the Joint Committee on Taxation.”

subsection.heading: Number and selection
subsection.chapeau: The Joint Committee shall be composed of 10 members as follows:

content.p: Five members who are members of the Committee on Finance of the Senate, three from the majority and two from the minority party, to be chosen by such Committee; and

paragraph.heading: From Committee on Ways and Means

content.p: Five members who are members of the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives, three from the majority and two from the minority party, to be chosen by such Committee.
No person shall continue to serve as a member of the Joint Committee after he has ceased to be a member of the Committee by which he was chosen, except that—

The members chosen by the Committee on Ways and Means who have been reelected to the House of Representatives may continue to serve as members of the Joint Committee notwithstanding the expiration of the Congress.

subsection.heading: Vacancies
subsection.chapeau: A vacancy in the Joint Committee—

content.p: Shall not affect the power of the remaining members to execute the functions of the Joint Committee; and

paragraph.heading: Manner of filling
paragraph.chapeau: Shall be filled in the same manner as the original selection, except that—

content.p: In case of a vacancy during an adjournment or recess of Congress for a period of more than 2 weeks, the members of the Joint Committee who are members of the Committee entitled to fill such vacancy may designate a member of such Committee to serve until his successor is chosen by such Committee; and

In the case of a vacancy after the expiration of a Congress which would be filled by the Committee on Ways and Means, the members of such Committee who are continuing to serve as members of the Joint Committee may designate a person who, immediately prior to such expiration, was a member of such Committee and who is re-elected to the House of Representatives, to serve until his successor is chosen by such Committee.

The members shall serve without compensation in addition to that received for their services as members of Congress; but they shall be reimbursed for travel, subsistence, and other necessary expenses incurred by them in the performance of the duties vested in the Joint Committee, other than expenses in connection with meetings of the Joint Committee held in the District of Columbia during such times as the Congress is in session.

section.heading: Election of chairman and vice chairman

content.p: The Joint Committee shall elect a chairman and vice chairman from among its members.

Except as otherwise provided by law, the Joint Committee shall have power to appoint and fix the compensation of the Chief of Staff of the Joint Committee and such experts and clerical, stenographic, and other assistants as it deems advisable.

note.heading: Amendments
note.p: 1976—Pub. L. 94–455 substituted “compensation of the Chief of Staff of the Joint Committee” for “compensation of a clerk” after “appoint and fix the”.

note.heading: Effective Date of 1976 Amendment
note.p: Amendment by Pub. L. 94–455 effective on first day of first month which begins more than 90 days after Oct. 4, 1976, see section 1907(c) of Pub. L. 94–455, set out as a note under section 8001 of this title.

content.p: The expenses of the Joint Committee shall be paid one-half from the contingent fund of the Senate and one-half from the contingent fund of the House of Representatives, upon vouchers signed by the chairman or the vice chairman.
